STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 7, 2023
Kari Klinski
LINCOLN CENTER
1961 LINCOLN ST,
HIGHLAND PARK, MI, 48203-3077
Re: License #: CI820293953
Sir 2024C0000854SI
Dear Kari Ann Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the manager at 616-552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI820293953
Licensee Group Organization: Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services
Licensee Designee: Kari Klinski
Chief Administrator: Kari Klinski
Agency Name: LINCOLN CENTER
Agency Address: 1961 LINCOLN ST
HIGHLAND PARK, MI 48203-3077
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 04/20/2024
Capacity: 10
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
10/23/2023 Face to Face Special Investigation Initiation
10/23/23 Face to Face Video Observation
10/23/23 Face to Face Interviews
10/24/2023 Email Special Evaluation
10/24/2023 Phone Special Investigation Initiation
10/26/23 Email Documentation requested
10/30/23 Email Documentation requested
11/1/23 Email Documentation requested
11/4/23 Email Documentation Received
11/13/23 Email Documentation requested
11/13/23 Email DHS Worker 1
11/21/23 Email MIC Disposition
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth’s behavior, chronological and
developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was restrained in a prone position and was choked resulting
in a bloody nose.
Investigation On 10/23/23 I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
that Youth A was involved in an incident on 10/13/23.
Administrator 1 reported a restraint was not completed with Youth
A. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present the entire time and Youth A
was holding onto staff and wouldn’t let them go. Administrator 1
reported this happened in and near Youth A’s bedroom.
Administrator 1 reported that Youth A did have a bloody nose after
the incident. Administrator 1 reported she found out about the
incident five days later Youth A went to see Nurse 1 on 10/18/23
for his shoulder hurting. Youth A then told Nurse 1 what had
happened and then this information was passed on to
Administrator 1 on 10/19/23.
On 10/23/23, I spoke to Complainant 1. No new information was
provided.
Foster Care Worker 1 was contacted on 10/20/23 and provided
background information on Youth A.
I reviewed video footage of the incident: Incident is dated
10/13/23. I watched video footage from 7:12:00pm
to7:35:26pm:
7:12:00: Staff 1 goes into Youth A’s bedroom. Supervisor 1 is
already in the room with Youth A.
7:14:36: Staff 1 is coming out of the room and Youth A grabs him.
Staff 3 comes over from the unit to assist.
7:15:21: Youth A is on the ground partially in the unit and in the
bedroom. He is attempting to keep the bedroom door opened.
7:15:23: Staff 1 grabs Youth A’s legs and drags him into his
bedroom.
2

7:15:23: Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 are now in the bedroom with
Youth A. Staff 2 is at the door entranceway.
Over the next couple minutes Staff 3 goes in and out of the
bedroom.
7:23:14: Staff 2 leaves the door and brings paper towels back with
him
7:24:28: Staff 2 goes back to get more paper towels and goes into
the room.
Up until 7:33:53, all staff are in and out of the room with Youth A.
At 7:35:26 Staff 3 arrives and goes into the room with Youth A
alone.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility:
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported Youth A was being escorted into his room by Staff
1 and Supervisor 1. They got him into the room and then
attempted to leave. Youth A then crawled on the floor of his room
positioning himself so they were unable to close the door. Staff 2
reported that Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 went into the room with
Youth A. Staff 2 reported he saw pushing and shoving from Staff
1, Supervisor 1 and Youth A. Staff 2 reported this was not trained
in their restraint model Handle with Care. Staff 2 reported he saw
them attempting to do Handle with Care, but the pushing and
shoving were not a part of what they were taught. Staff 2 reported
when Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 were still in the room Youth A had
a bloody nose. Staff 2 reported he grabbed paper towels for Youth
A and then Staff 3 came and talked to Youth A. Staff 2 would not
say how Youth A received the bloody nose.
Youth A:
Youth A reported he refused to go into his room, so Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 forced him into it. Youth A reported he was
restrained on the floor and bed. Youth A reported they accidently
hit him in the nose during the restraint and caused him to bleed.
Youth A reported that Staff 1 placed him in a chokehold during the
restraint, but this did not cause the bloody nose. Youth A reported
that after the incident Staff 3 came in and talked to him.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported they use physical management when there are
violent situations. Staff 1 reported they use escorts to assist the
youth into their room or designated area. Staff 1 reported the
escorts are sometimes voluntarily but “90%” of the times the youth
do not want to be touched and this escalates the situation. Staff 1
reported that Supervisors on the unit are the ones that initiate the
3

restraints. Staff 1 reported that Youth A went into his room
voluntarily. Supervisor 1 was there as well. Both walked him into
his room and when they were leaving Youth A’s room, Youth A
grabbed him from the back, pulling his shirt and arms. Supervisor
1 came into the room and attempted to pry Youth A’s fingers from
his shirt. Staff 2 then came to the door. Supervisor 1 was able to
get Youth A’s hands away from Staff 1. Staff 1 reported there was
no pushing or shoving in the room. Staff 2 reported he did fall to
the ground at one point when Youth A pulled him by his arms.
Staff 1 reported both he and Youth A fell to the ground. Supervisor
1 then pulled Youth An off him and they went to go out the door
when Youth A grabbed his legs. Supervisor 1 was able to remove
Youth A from his legs and then they pulled Youth A up and he had
a bloody nose. Staff 1 reported they helped him get to the bed and
talked to him. Staff 2 came in with some paper towels. Youth A
then wanted to leave the room again and all three attempted to
keep him in the room. Staff 1 reported that he and Supervisor 1
grabbed his arms and pinned him up against the wall. Staff 3 then
switched out himself and left and went to the camera room. Staff 1
then reported that he saw Staff 3 enter the room. Staff 1 did not
have any more information.
Staff 2 was re-interviewed:
Staff 2 reported he never restrained Youth A and never held Youth
A’s arms at any point Youth A was in the room. Staff 2 reported he
did see Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 hold Youth A up against the wall
and did see them on the ground at one point. Staff 2 then reported
that Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 were chest to chest with Youth A at
one point and pushing and shoving him. Staff 2 reported this was
an unsafe situation but didn’t say anything during the incident
because it is the supervisors call to make in those situations.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he was completing his rounds when he saw
Youth A cornering a female staff in the unit. Supervisor 1 reported
that Staff 1 was with him, and Youth A went into his room
voluntarily and sat on the floor. Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 talked to
him and then went to leave when Youth A “bear hugged” Staff 1.
Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1 was attempting to get away from
Youth A and was doing anything he could to get away from him.
Both Staff 1 and Youth A went to the floor and Supervisor 1
reported that he was able to separate them from each other.
Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1 got up from the floor and then
Youth A had a bloody nose. Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A
gets bloody noses when he is upset. Supervisor 1 reported that
Youth A told him that it was normal for this to happen. Supervisor
4

1 reported he didn’t know this about Youth A before this incident.
Supervisor 1 reported they obtained paper towels for his nose.
Supervisor 1 reported they never restrained Youth A nor did they
ever have him up against the wall. Staff 1 left and Staff 3 came in
the room and stayed with Youth A.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported that he came into the unit to help. Staff 3 reported
that Staff 1, Staff 3, and Supervisor 1 were in the unit. Staff 3 went
into the room with Youth A and talked to hm alone. Staff 3
reported that he saw that he had a nosebleed and asked Youth A
“what happened?” Staff 3 reported that Youth A disclosed he was
“wrestling” with Staff 1 and that Staff 1 had “choked him”. Staff 3
reported Youth A did not tell him the nosebleed was from “getting
worked up.” Staff 3 reported that Youth A gets worked up a lot and
has never had a nosebleed. Staff 3 reported that Youth A hates
going into his room, and this is a normal behavior for him. Staff 3
reported he is not aware of why he doesn’t like to go into his room.
Staff 3 reported he does not know why Youth A is here or if he has
any medical needs or mental health diagnosis.
Documentation Reviewed:
The incident report was written on 10/18/23 after Administrator 1
became aware of the incident. Administrator 1 reported that the
incident report was written on this date. The actual incident report
does not have a date of completion on it. Administrator 1 signed
the Incident report on 10/20/23. The document was written by
Supervisor 1; noted as an “informational” incident report.
…while being counseled, Youth A began to grab at Staff 1’s
clothes, arms, and legs to prevent him from leaving the room.
Youth A became hostile and anxious, causing his nose to
bleed. This writer and Staff 1 assisted Youth A in cleaning up
the blood off of the floor, while continue to counsel him on
regaining self-control…
Documentation was requested for all witnesses but was not
provided due to it not being completed.
Analysis Youth A sustained a nosebleed from the improper restrain
completed by Staff 1 and Supervisor 1. Video observation shows
Youth A being dragged by his leg into the bedroom by Staff 1.
Although there are inconsistent accounts of the incident by Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Supervisor 1, all but Supervisor 1 reported Youth A
was restrained in some manner.
5

• Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 were
attempting to use Handle with Care to restrain Youth A but
were pushing and shoving the youth.
• Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 pinned Youth A up
against the wall while restraining him.
• Youth A reported he was restrained on the bed and on the
floor and was accidently hit in the nose which caused his
nosebleed.
• Staff 1 reported he and Supervisor 1 pinned Youth A’s
arms up against the wall to restrain him.
• Supervisor 1 reported they never restrained Youth A or
pinned him up against the wall.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Supervisor 1 all reported that
Youth A had a bloody nose from the incident. No one other
than Supervisor 1 was able to verbalize how this happened.
Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A gets nose bleeds when
he is escalating.
• Video observation shows Staff 1 dragging Youth A in the
bedroom and Staff 2 retrieving paper towels for Youth A’s
nosebleed. Staff 3 confirmed the nosebleed.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2023C0000773SI; Intake 9/19/23, CAP Approved
SIR 2023C0000809SI; Intake 9/20/23, CAP Pending
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Staff qualifications
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
Description following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff do not have the ability to perform their jobs
Investigation Staff personnel files were reviewed for Staff 1, Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1.
Staff 1 was hired on 3/29/23. Staff 1 received orientation, policies
and procedure training, discipline policies, crisis intervention-
verbal de-escalation and physical practicum trainings and well as
Child Management technique training.
6

Supervisor 1 was hired on 7/21/08. Supervisor 1 was trained on
verbal de-escalation on 2/29/23, Handle with Care on 3/23/23,
Child Management Techniques on 6/1/23, Employee policies and
Procedures on 4/6/23, Mental Health Training on 9/21/23, Lincoln
Management-Communication, pod Concerns/updates on 1/26/23
and 3/9/23, Policy and procedure updates, common sense and
policies on 7/6/23.
Analysis Both Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 have been trained on how to
deescalate youth verbally and how to use handle with care. Both
have been trained on how to write incident reports and witness
statements. Both have been trained on child management
techniques. Supervisor 1 has received additional training in how to
communicate about pod concerns and had additional policy
trainings. Although both have been trained by the facility, neither
displayed the ability to perform those functions in the incident on
10/13/23. Staff 1 had dragged Youth A into the bedroom and
pinned Youth A up against the wall with the help of Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1 reported there was not a restraint in the room, nor
did he communicate the incident to anyone, although Youth A
received a bloody nose from the incident. Neither requested
medical for the youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established.
2023C0000484: Intake 5/23/23, CAP Approved
2023C0000575: Intake 6/28/23, CAP Approved
2023C0000437: Intake 5/2/23, CAP Approved
2023C0000486: Intake 5/24/23. CAP Approved
2023C0000650SI: Intake 7/26/23, CAP Approved
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting
Description (2) Health status screening of the youth will occur
immediately after seclusion or restraint by staff assigned to
this screening, as defined in agency policy. If the youth has
any physical complaints or if the screening staff has any
concerns, depending on the severity of the complaint or
concerns, the staff will arrange for the youth’s health needs
to be met immediately by any of the following actions:
(a) Consultation with the on-call or onsite nursing staff.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
7

Allegation Youth was not seen by medical after restraint. Youth had a bloody
nose and neck pain.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 reported it is everyone’s job to make sure that a youth goes
to the hospital if there is imminent danger to the youth. Staff 1
reported that after a restraint and escort a youth is to be seen by
the nurse but there is not necessarily a time frame on when that
occurs. Staff 1 reported the facility manager will make the
assessment of when and whether a hospital visit is necessary.
Staff 2 and Staff 3 both reported Youth A had a bloody nose from
the incident.
Youth A reported he had a bloody nose form the incident.
Supervisor 1 reported that Staff 1 got up from the floor and then
Youth A had a bloody nose. Supervisor 1 reported that Youth A
gets bloody noses when he is upset. Supervisor 1 reported that
Youth A told him that it was normal for this to happen. Supervisor
1 reported he didn’t know this about Youth A before this incident.
Supervisor 1 reported that they cleaned him up and didn’t think
about sending him to the nurse.
Nurse 1:
Nurse 1 reported she never received a referral for Youth A to be
seen after an incident on 10/13/23. Nurse 1 reported she received
the referral after he was seen on 10/18/23.
Documentation:
I reviewed the Medical Assessment/Progress Note dated
10/18/23, completed by Nurse 1:
“Seen on pod youth escorted to his room, possible physical
management. Youth denies pain or injury from today, reports
nasal and neck injury from Friday. This is the first report to writer.
Per youth, restrained by Staff 1 over and over again with chest
and face down on his bed was then “choked” Staff 1 had this
youth in a chokehold per his report.”
I reviewed the Trident Care Medical Documentation dated
10/20/23:
8

There was no “acute fracture or dislocation. Nasal septum intact
and midline. Soft tissue normal. Sinuses clear.”
Analysis Youth A was not seen after he was restrained on 10/13/23
although he suffered injuries. All staff and youth reported that he
received a bloody nose from the incident. A health status
screening should have been completed immediately after the
incident.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0000809SI; Intake 10/2/23: CAP pending
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form
prescribed by the department for each incident involving the
use of seclusion or restraint. The initial report shall be
submitted to the department within 24 hours of the incident
occurring. A final incident report shall be submitted no later
than 72 hours after the incident has occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Incident report was not written for restraint.
Investigation On 10/23/23 I spoke to Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
that Youth A was involved in an incident on 10/13/23.
Administrator 1 reported a restraint was not completed with Youth
A. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present the entire time and was holding
onto staff and wouldn’t let them go. Administrator 1 reported this
happened in and near Youth A’s bedroom. Administrator 1
reported that Youth A did have a bloody nose after the incident.
Administrator 1 reported she found out about the incident five
days later Youth A went to see Nurse 1 on 10/18/23 for his
shoulder hurting. Youth A then told Nurse 1 what had happened
and then this information was passed on to Administrator 1. An
incident report was not written for the incident nor for the bloody
nose. Administrator 1 reported this was completed after she found
out about the incident.
Staff 1 reported that incident reports are to be written for escorts
and restraints. Staff 1 reported that staff would write an incident
report and then all that were involved would complete a write up
and provide this to the facility manager. Staff 1 reported that
9

sometimes the facility manager completes the incident reports for
them though. Staff 1 then changed this process and stated that
staff do not write the incident report. They can choose to do so
voluntarily or of the facility manager asks them to do this, but it is
the normal function of the facility manager. Staff 1 reported he did
not write an incident report or anything else for the incident. Staff 1
reported that on 10/18/23, Supervisor 1 came to him and told him
to write up something for the specific date. Staff 1 is not the author
of the incident report.
Supervisor 1 reported he never write an incident report because
he thought what happened could be debriefed verbally and did not
think it rose to incident report writing. It was only “informational.”
Documentation:
The Unusual and Critical Incident Policy was reviewed:
All SJJS employees and volunteers are responsible for
documenting any and all Unusual (out of the ordinary) Incident
involving youth. All Unusual Incidents must be recorded on the
appropriate Unusual Incident Witness Statement by the staff
person witnessing or involved in the incident prior to the end of the
shift in which the incident occurred. The Facility Manager must
complete a summary documentation of the Incident before the
supervisor completed their scheduled workday…the supervisor
shall complete the Unusual Incident Summary Form and forward it
to the Facility Manager for immediate review and Center Director
for subsequent…
Documentation was requested for all witnesses but was not
provided due to it not being completed.
Analysis The agency did not complete an incident report for the restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records
Section (1)An institution shall maintain employee records for each
Description employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
10

(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency,
or equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The
documentation shall be completed not more than 30 days
prior to the start of employment and every 12 months
thereafter.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not have their central registry clearances completed
before hire.
Investigation I reviewed the central registry for all three staff, and all were
cleared on the following dates:
• Staff 1 was hired on 3/29/23 and central registry was
completed on 10/26/23.
• Staff 2 was hired on 4/19/23 and central registry was
completed on 9/15/23.
• Staff 3 was hired on 3/1/23 and central registry was
completed on 10/26/23.
Analysis All three staff have been working at the facility without central
registry clearances for a substantial period of time.
Technical Assistance: This is a repeat violation and due to the
safety issues attached to this violation, it is recommended that all
employee files are reviewed to ensure updated central registry
has been completed as well as initial central registry. If there are
staff that do not have clearances completed, they are to be
removed from the schedule until clearances are completed and
approved.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
Interim Inspection 6/14/23
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
11

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The agency did not follow Child Protection Law; mandated
reporting.
Investigation Intake for allegations was received on 10/19/23. Incident occurred
on 10/13/23. Allegations were not provided to centralized intake
until 10/19/23.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported that he came into the unit to help on 10/13/23.
Staff 3 reported that Staff 1, Staff 3, and Supervisor 1 were in the
unit. Staff 3 went into the room with Youth A and talked to hm
alone. Staff 3 reported that he saw that he had a nosebleed and
asked Youth A “what happened?” Staff 3 reported that Youth A
disclosed he was “wrestling” with Staff 1 and that Staff 1 had
“choked him”. Staff 3 reported Youth A did not tell him the
nosebleed was from “getting worked up.” Staff 3 reported that
Youth A gets worked up a lot and has never had a nosebleed.
Staff 2 was re-interviewed:
Staff 2 reported he never restrained Youth A and never held Youth
A’s arms at any point Youth A was in the room. Staff 2 reported he
did see Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 hold Youth A up against the wall
and did see them on the ground at one point. Staff 2 then reported
that Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 were chest to chest with Youth A at
one point and pushing and shoving him. Staff 2 reported this was
an unsafe situation but didn’t say anything during the incident
because it is the supervisors call to make in those situations.
Analysis Child protection Law states the reporting of suspected abuse and
neglect is to be reported to centralized intake. Both Staff 3 and
Staff 2 are mandated reporters according to law and did not
complete a report after the incident on 10/13/23.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2022C0207010 Intake 11/24/21
2023C0000468 Intake 5/17/23
12

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the license be changed to a 1st Provisional License based on
SIR2024C0000787SI.
11/28/23

Licensing Consultant

13
